column4: *sigh* another hour, another newbie question...can someone tell me how to stop a drive from being shown on desktop? even better to stop linux from even bothering to acknowledge the drive's existence?
run gconf-editor ... then navigate to /apps/nautilus/desktop/volumes_visible and disable it
if it's just a particular partition, you can stop it automounting by removing the relevant line in /etc/fstab
